page.title: 01QUEEN VICTORIA SCHOOL(FOUND)
page.content: The school was subscribed to by every working person in Scotland. It was opened by King Edward 7th in 1908 as a memorial to Queen Victoria and to the Scottish soldiers and sailors who died in the South African War. It was also visited by Queen Elizabeth 2nd on its 50th anniversary. The school is for boys from nine-and a-half to eighteen who are sons of serving or former Scottish servicemen and women of the Regular forces. The parent must be either Scottish born or serve in a Scottish regiment and,if an officer ,must have served at least four years in the ranks. More information and pictures can be seen in "Soldier" magazine Aug 1973.
